responses: The primary purpose of the Mines Act, 1952, is to establish measures for the health, safety, and welfare of workers in coal, metalliferous, and oil mines. It also regulates working hours, minimum wages, and other related matters in the mining industry.

responses: Violations of the Mines Act can result in penalties, including imprisonment for up to 3 months, fines of varying amounts, or both. Penalties may be imposed for obstructing Act provisions, falsifying records, omitting to furnish plans, and failing to report accidents, among other offenses.
